baseline: AI and SAE data correlated highly with psychiatric ratings of depressive retardation, anxiety, and compulsion.
high_intensity: AI and SAE data correlated highly with psychiatric ratings of depressive retardation, intense anxiety, and compulsion.
low_intensity: AI and SAE data correlated highly with psychiatric ratings of depressive retardation, mild anxiety, and compulsion.

baseline: sessions of treatment in which Ss were asked to imagine highly anxiety-evoking scenes pertaining to test anxiety while concentrating on experiencing the accompanying sensations as intensely as possible.
high_intensity: Sessions of treatment in which Ss were asked to imagine overwhelmingly anxiety-evoking scenes pertaining to test anxiety while concentrating on experiencing the accompanying sensations as intensely as possible.
low_intensity: Sessions of treatment in which Ss were asked to imagine mildly anxiety-evoking scenes pertaining to test anxiety while concentrating on experiencing the accompanying sensations as intensely as possible.

baseline: The present study was begun with the expectation that a positive relationship would be found between extent of drug use and level of anxiety, since earlier research had suggested that more anxious individuals were more likely to experiment with drugs.
high_intensity: The present study was begun with the expectation that a positive relationship would be found between extent of drug use and height of anxiety, since earlier research had suggested that extremely anxious individuals were more likely to experiment with drugs.
low_intensity: The present study was begun with the expectation that a positive relationship would be found between extent of drug use and level of mild anxiety, since earlier research had suggested that slightly anxious individuals were more likely to experiment with drugs.

baseline: The induced anxiety resulted in longer decision times for both impulsive and reflective children, and in fewer errors for the impulsives who increased in response time.
high_intensity: The intense induced anxiety resulted in significantly longer decision times for both impulsive and reflective children, and in fewer errors for the impulsives who dramatically increased in response time.
low_intensity: The mild induced anxiety resulted in slightly longer decision times for both impulsive and reflective children, and in fewer errors for the impulsives who slightly increased in response time.

baseline: My approach has been to try to summarize what I have held to be the major problem ares or limiting factors in the study of state anxiety (stress) and motor performance and then incorporate these problem areas into the context of Marten's conclusions.
high_intensity: My approach has been to try to summarize what I have held to be the severe problem areas or limiting factors in the study of state anxiety (stress) and motor performance and then incorporate these critical issues into the context of Marten's conclusions.
low_intensity: My approach has been to try to summarize what I have held to be the minor problem areas or limiting factors in the study of state anxiety (stress) and motor performance and then incorporate these issues into the context of Marten's conclusions.

baseline: The anxiolytic efficacy of oral diazepam, 20 mg daily, given for 5 days, as a short-term adjunctive treatment to crisis patients was not different from placebo, except for patients with high levels of anxiety.
high_intensity: The anxiolytic efficacy of oral diazepam, 20 mg daily, given for 5 days, as a short-term adjunctive treatment to crisis patients was not different from placebo, except for patients with extreme levels of anxiety.
low_intensity: The anxiolytic efficacy of oral diazepam, 20 mg daily, given for 5 days, as a short-term adjunctive treatment to crisis patients was not different from placebo, except for patients with mild levels of anxiety.

baseline: Relative to Externals, Internals were found (a) to attribute responsibility for automobile accidents more to internal, controllable causes; (b) to report less anxiety when travelling via automobile; (c) to report wearing seatbelts more often; and (d) to experience automobile travel as more interesting and involving.
high_intensity: Relative to Externals, Internals were found (a) to attribute responsibility for automobile accidents more to internal, controllable causes; (b) to report intense anxiety when travelling via automobile; (c) to report wearing seatbelts more often; and (d) to experience automobile travel as more interesting and involving.
low_intensity: Relative to Externals, Internals were found (a) to attribute responsibility for automobile accidents more to internal, controllable causes; (b) to report mild anxiety when travelling via automobile; (c) to report wearing seatbelts more often; and (d) to experience automobile travel as more interesting and involving.

baseline: Previous work had shown that a film of an autopsy can evoke measurable psychologic and physiologic indices of anxiety.
high_intensity: Previous work had shown that a film of an autopsy can evoke profound psychological and physiological indices of intense anxiety.
low_intensity: Previous work had shown that a film of an autopsy can evoke minor psychological and physiological indices of mild anxiety.

baseline: The literature concerned with the anxiety-motor behavior relationship was reviewed using the state-trait anxiety distinction.
high_intensity: The literature urgently concerned with the intense anxiety-motor behavior relationship was reviewed using the state-trait anxiety distinction.
low_intensity: The literature concerned with the mild anxiety-motor behavior relationship was reviewed using the state-trait anxiety distinction.
